featureType.name: qgis_irmt_7d88c3fb_2b41_4a25_9029_adf4cd6fae90
featureType.title: SoVI-BC_Version1
featureType.abstract:
The Geological Survey of Canada (GSC) is working in partnership with the Global Earthquake Model Foundation (GEM) to develop a regional multi-level Social Vulnerability (SoVI) model for British Columbia. Outputs will be incorporated into an integrated earthquake risk assessment for the Province of British Columbia.
This layer represents results of a single level SoVI model for the entire Province. It does not reflect variations that are known to exist from region to region based on community type. Subsequent versions of the model will incorporate multi-level variations for 7 distinct community types. These include: SAC Type 1: Urban Metropolitan Centre SAC Type 2: Urban Agglomeration Area (Pop>10,000) with administrative subdivisions SAC Type 3:Urban Agglomeration Area (Pop>10,000) with no administrative subdivisions SAC Type 4:Exurban Regional District with strong metropolitan influence SAC Type 5:Exurban Regional District with moderate metropolitan influence SAC Type 6:Rural District with weak metropolitan influence SAC Type 7:Rural District with no metropolitan influence
